page.title: 06Farming
page.content: Most of the farms in our area are dairy farms,but some have beef and sheep as well. As they are dairy farmers,when they joined the Common Market,the milk prices shot up. Most of the farmers'fields are used for grazing and the cows the farmers use come from Thornbury or Gloucester. If the rain comes in June it will prevent hay-cutting and snow in Winter will freeze up the water for the animals. The fields are drained by a rhine, running down the side of the road, which is drained once a year by South Gloucester Drainage,paid by the Drainage Rate.It is cleaned well once every seven years and every year just to clean out the reeds,weeds,etc. In February it's the lambing season. In late April they harrow and roll
